race.name: Gravel Fondo Louisiana
race.tagline: Louisiana rolling hills gravel in St. Francisville.

climate.description: Variable conditions with heat and humidity possible.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through rolling southeast Louisiana hills. Moderate elevation with rural scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional LA event. Rolling hills terrain with moderate organization and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Gravel Fondo Louisiana is a regional event in St. Francisville, southeast Louisiana. The rolling hills terrain offers moderate climbing with rural scenery, but the moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. St. Francisville provides moderate access. It's a solid regional event for Louisiana cyclists.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional Louisiana gravel race with rolling hills terrain. Worth it for Louisiana cyclists seeking a local event. Not a destination race for out-of-state travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: Louisiana rolling hills gravel in St. Francisville.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Louisiana and want a local rolling hills event—yes, it's a solid regional race. If you're from out of state—there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Southeast events: Cohutta, Southern Cross. For similar regional events: other LA gravel races.

logistics.airport: Baton Rouge (BTR) 45 minutes or New Orleans (MSY) 2 hours
logistics.lodging_strategy: St. Francisville has limited lodging. Baton Rouge has more options.
logistics.food: Small town with limited dining. Stock nutrition.

course_description.character: Rolling Louisiana hills gravel with moderate climbing.
course_description.signature_challenge: Louisiana rolling hills gravel in St. Francisville.

non_negotiables.why: Louisiana rolling hills require sustained effort.
LA spring/fall means heat and humidity are likely.

topics.heat: Racing in LA heat and humidity

marketplace_variables.race_hook: Louisiana rolling hills gravel in St. Francisville.

prestige.explanation: This race doesn't exist in any cycling calendar, directory, or forum discussion I can find. No history, no notable winners, no media coverage - it's either brand new or so under the radar it might as well be invisible. The gravel scene in Louisiana isn't known for marquee events, and 65 miles with minimal elevation isn't grabbing headlines.

race_quality.explanation: Can't judge what doesn't appear to exist in any searchable form. No course details, no aid station info, no timing systems mentioned anywhere. Either this is a ghost race or so poorly promoted that basic operational details are completely absent from the cycling world.

experience.explanation: St. Francisville sits in Louisiana's West Feliciana Parish with rolling plantation country and Mississippi River bluffs - decent scenery potential. The area has historic charm with antebellum architecture, but without actual course details or rider reports, I'm guessing at what you'd actually see. Could be pleasant backroads or could be highway shoulders.

community.explanation: Louisiana cycling community tends to be tight-knit and welcoming, especially in smaller towns like St. Francisville. Southern hospitality usually translates to good post-ride food and friendly volunteers. But with zero online presence or community discussion about this event, that's pure speculation based on regional cycling culture.

field_depth.explanation: No registration data, no past results, no field size information anywhere. A 65-mile gravel race in rural Louisiana isn't attracting national talent or deep competitive fields. Likely a small local affair with weekend warriors and regional riders if it exists at all. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: Louisiana races typically run reasonable entry fees, and the cost of living in St. Francisville is low compared to major cycling destinations. Without knowing actual registration costs or what's included, I'm assuming standard regional pricing. The adventure-to-dollar ratio could be decent if they actually put on a race.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $60-100. St. Francisville is small-town affordable - cheap gas, reasonable lodging, no big-city markup on food. Closest major airport is Baton Rouge about 30 minutes away with decent flight options. The area won't break your budget, assuming you can find places that are actually open when you need them. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

length.explanation: 65 miles hits the sweet spot for most gravel riders - long enough to be challenging without being an all-day suffer-fest. Good distance for testing fitness without requiring ultra-endurance prep. Standard gran fondo length that works for both competitive riders and enthusiasts looking for a solid day out. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Louisiana terrain is typically flat to rolling with straightforward gravel roads - no rock gardens, no alpine descents, no technical features that'll test bike handling skills. The Mississippi River bluff area around St. Francisville has some hills but nothing that demands mountain bike skills or advanced technique. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 3000 feet over 65 miles averages under 50 feet per mile - rolling but not mountainous. Louisiana's highest point is 535 feet, so you're not getting sustained climbing or serious gradient challenges. Enough ups and downs to keep it interesting but won't separate the climbers from the pack. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Louisiana in summer is brutal - oppressive humidity, 90+ degree heat, and thunderstorms that roll in fast. Spring and fall offer better conditions but still humid and unpredictable. Winter can actually be pleasant for riding, but timing a gravel race around Louisiana weather is always a gamble. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: St. Francisville sits at about 100 feet above sea level near the Mississippi River. Zero altitude considerations - you're basically at sea level the entire time. If you're coming from elevation, this might actually feel easier due to the oxygen density. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

logistics.explanation: Small town logistics can be simple - easy parking, less traffic, straightforward course marking if done right. Baton Rouge airport is accessible, and the area has basic amenities. The downside is limited options if something goes wrong, and rural Louisiana infrastructure isn't always reliable.

adventure.explanation: Louisiana backroads through plantation country offer some historic intrigue and southern culture, but it's not epic wilderness adventure. The terrain lacks the dramatic features that make gravel racing memorable - no mountain vistas, no desert isolation, just rural roads through farmland and forests.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

youtube_data.search_query: Gravel Fondo Louisiana gravel race St. Francisville

videos.title: 2021 Gran Fondo St. Francisville -1st Place Finish
videos.description: What a great inaugural event (St. Francisville Gran Fondo)! Just focused on staying with the 1st group and on Evan's wheel as long as I could until the groups split up (20, 40, 60 mile groups). Little did I know I'd end with a 21.8 mph average! That was such a fun and stamina-building ride! I used a lot of  my experience and knowledge in riding the rolling hills throughout the ride. It's not about trying to ride fast uphill, but rather minimizing slowdown during a climb by using tactical gear-shifting. Loved having the pace car leading. It reminded me and made me "feel" like we were in the Tour de France! It was a great event on a beautiful day!

videos.curation_reason: First-person race recap from the inaugural event winner with detailed course commentary and performance data.

videos.title: Gravel Events You Should Know About: SE USA
videos.description:
Gravel Cycling Events that you should know about, Southeastern USA.

Not Corporate, Not Expensive, in some cases, Free, in what we like to call around here, 100% legit grass roots, not just calling themselves grass roots. More to come soon from other regions of the USA, and possibly outside of the USA. Stay tuned...

Enjoy - JOM, Founder of Gravel Cyclist

videos.transcript:
good day trend setters coming to you
today poolside in the sunshine of North
Central Florida where it's a weed bit
brisk today but thankful to be outside
today I'm coming to you with my list of
gravel cycling events you should know
about in the southeastern United States
these events are not corporate not
expensive and in some cases free and
epitomize the true meaning of Grassroots
gravel cycling versus just calling
themselves Grassroots gravel cycling
these events are not listed in any
particular order and again they focus on
the southeastern United States there'll
be more videos in this series coming
later kicking off is the north Florida
Free Ride gravel series a longstanding
series of free events there are 8 to 10
events in this series and it goes into
its 14th year of operation with its OG
event the heartbreaker cycling
Invitational a homage to Tom Petty this
event is held near Gainesville Florida
I'm very proud to be a co-founder of
this event series along with my good
mate Todd good day mate if you're
watching we welcome all Riders of any
ability to show up and ride no
registration is required just bring a
positive attitude and have a fun time as
we love to Showcase this part of North
Central Florida another event in this
series hosted by Todd is the hell of the
norla 200 M of of mixed surface riding
here in North Central Florida why pay a
bunch of money to ride 200 Mi when you
can ride here for free there are gas
stations convenience stores along the
way for your support what's not to love
the north Florida Free Ride gravel
series is on Facebook check it out
Linked In the description below another
event series This Time by my good mate
Carlos AKA The Single track Samurai
whether you're into multi-day bike
packing ride or single day mixed surface
cycling Adventures Carlos has you
covered I've had the pleasure of riding
at least two of Carlos's mixed surface
cycling events but one of his most
famous and worthy of mention is the
Huracan the 300 there's also a 400 and
this year there's even a gravel bike
friendly version the Huracan 330 you can
check out details of Carlos AKA The
Single track Samurai link in the
description below next up the laughing
donkey Invitational near Tifton Georgia
hosted by Jean Gman good day Jean if
you're watching and his crew of
volunteers this 100% free event
showcases a beautiful part of Georgia
with very quiet Farm roads and pleasant
scenery for your riding pleasure despite
being free this event has many sponsors
that give back to the community in fact
the event supports a local scholarship
that goes towards postsecondary
education really good stuff next up the
hom growing gravel Adventure located in
Franklin Georgia about 1 hour from
Atlanta's Hartfield Jackson airports
this event is hosted by longstanding
cycling promoter Mr Wayne Whitesides
good day Wayne if you're watching there
are several businesses on offer so
there's something for everybody and on
the longer distances takes Riders from
Georgia crossing the border into Alabama
and back again check out the details
Linked In the description below next up
the dirty pan or is it the dirty pean of
Montello or is it Montello Florida
located near the capital Tallahassee I
love this event I've ridden many many
iterations of the dirty pan there are
six distances on offer 40 Mi 60 Mi 80 Mi
100 Mi 150 Mi and the macdaddy 200 Mi
with which was added a couple of years
ago I've ridden the 80 the 100 and the
150 challenging riding no matter which
distance you take and fantastic scenery
on tap clay roads and the longer routes
take you from Florida and into Georgia
and the entry cost is just $25
absolutely Bonkers all of the money
raised by this event benefit a local 4H
program next up the Thomasville clayr
classic located in southern Georgia
Thomasville is a beautiful little town
but for 2025 the event takes on a
slightly different format starting at
the Pebble Hill Plantation there'll be
an expo wine tastings other fun stuff
and three distances on offer 30 Mi 50 Mi
and 80 Mi I've ridden this event on
several occasions it's particularly the
former 100 m distance that was once
offered by this event regardless it's
worthy of your consideration further
details Linked In the description below
quick interlude none of these events are
paying me to make this video it is a
grassroot cycling video next up the
gravel roll series of cycling events
ride them all or ride them alart if you
ride them all it'll cost you us
$210 this series features events in
Alabama Georgia and South Carolina
whilst I have not ridden any of the
events in this particular series I have
ridden in the areas that this series
covers love the riding you will too
further details Linked In the
description below next up the series of
events hosted by Chain Buster racing the
brainchild of Jason and Dawn Chandler
and their family these folks epitomize
the true meaning of grass routs cycling
chain Buster racing has been at it for
many years and these events are held in
states such as Georgia and Alabama some
of my favorites include the red clay
ramble and shake and break in Alabama
this event series is very worthy of your
consideration further the details are
linked in the description below next up
another favorite of mine the wild
chicken 100 named after the wild
chickens that inhabit the host Town
Fitzgerald Georgia I'm not kidding Trend
Setters there are wild chickens roaming
about the city the promoter Mr David
dark is a family man and an acquaintance
of mine good day Dave if you're watching
and honestly I have no idea how David
finds time to even run this event
thankfully he has a good team of
volunteers to help him with the
operational side of things beautiful
rural mix surface Road for your riding
pleasure further details are linked in
the description below next up one of the
longest standing mix surface cycling
events in the United States Southern
Cross of delonga Georgia starting and
finishing in the beautiful montal luche
Winery if you believe that Georgia is
flat ha well this event will change your
mind pretty quickly North Georgia is far
from Flat in fact part of this route
traverses at least two gaps AKA long
climbs that will challenge your climbing
legs in addition to that some
challenging descending thrown in as well
and more than likely there'll be some
hiker bike at least to start with and
possibly to end with a great event
challenging tough plenty of fun details
are linked in the description below next
up the hill hole gravel grind held in
Francis Marin State Forest aka the OG
the first legitimate gravel stage race
held in the United
States I have not ridden this event
myself but a couple of my mates have and
they tell me it's nothing to sneeze at
so be sure to bring your riding legs
there are three stages in total
including a very unique prologue stage
that happens at nighttime to
things off with the timed proceedings
now if a gravel stage race isn't your
thing you can ride two stages Grand
Fondo style at your own riding speed
details are linked in the description
below next up another Series this time
in North Carolina hosted by pisar
promotions aka Mr Eric Weaver and his
team of volunteers good day Eric if
you're watching there are two gravel
cycling events in this series pis gar
monster cross this event inspired me to
go out and build a drop bar mountain
bike way back in 2013 just to deal with
the rather dodgy descent you are likely
to encounter this event this was way
before any current gravel Pros had ever
thought of such an idea no disrespect to
the great Charlie Cunningham or John
Tomac for that matter P monster cross is
one of the early OG events particularly
in North Carolina adding to that Madness
this is the boot Lego 100 another tough
gravel cycling event featuring the
lovely Maple Sally road that goes up and
down up and down and you'll think winds
are going to end but the scenery is
spectacular details of the series is
a Tennessee event the gravel Revival of
Hickman County which is not too far from
Nashville Tennessee if you seek yourself
some dirt salvation the gravel Revival
is worthy of your consideration it's a
3-day gravel cycling Festival
spectacular unfortunately I've not
attended yet but I'm hoping to change
that in 2025 maybe I'll see you there
what's not to love Expo challenging
riding fun times learn more at the link
in the description below next up another
gravel series and this one's been around
for quite a long time in the fine state
of Mississippi the Mississippi gravel
Cup hosted by those trend setters Jason
and Wendy sheir this unique series
features four events starting in four
different towns in the state of
Mississippi unfortunately I have not
ridden any of Jason's events but I have
ridden in many of the areas that his
events feature fantastic scenery really
quiet rural roads further details of
this series are linked in the
description below and finally Rouge
rubay which isn't really a gravel
cycling event yet it's features gravel
roads located north of Baton Rouge in
the small town of St Francisville
Louisiana this is a road race aboard
road bikes there are two distances one
distance is about 50 Mi the other the
macdaddy at about
105 mil there are about 30 Mi of gravel
roads on the 100 plus mile distance this
is a challenging event if you like
racing this is one that you should
seriously consider I've had the pleasure
of racing this event three times and
I've had great luck where I managed to
somehow score top five in Masters when I
was a wee bit younger and I've had bad
luck where I had flat tires dodgy legs
and all sorts of goodness that
accompanies a day on the bike where
things don't always go so well but that
point aside this is an event as I
mentioned very worthy of your
consideration and hard-earned money ride
the tuna Hills of rouge Ru Bay further
below rodo Trend Setters that wraps up
the list for now without doubt there are
some events that I've missed some events
that are no longer operational feel free
to leave a respectful comment below if
you think there's an event worthy of
mention keep in mind the event should be
Grassroots as we like to call it around
here so it shouldn't cost a lot of cash
and ideally give back to the local
community in some way shape or form
coming soon I'll be covering other areas
of the United States so stay tuned for
that and potentially outside of the
United States as always thank you for
watching if you haven't already please
consider subscribing to the gravel
cyclist YouTube channel for interesting
factoid videos such as this one no bull
gravel bike reviews other product
reviews ride experience videos and of
course my favorite General Madness
somebody's going to the vet today except
for you and you're all excited because
you saw the leash Tuesday
all right then as all of it is released
to the channel I see you in the next
video
[Music]

videos.title: Rouge Roubaix
videos.description: March 13, 2013, Rouge Roubaix Category 4/5.  This is the first gravel section and me really falling off the back.  It turned into crash course on bike handling skills and a very lonely 104 mile ride.   I stuck it out and finished the race in over six hours.

videos.title: Rouge Roubaix 2013
videos.description: inMotion Photography presents.... highlights from Rouge Robaix 2013. Picture can be purchased at inmotionphoto.smugmug.com/sports. feel free to email us at nmotionphoto@yahoo.com for any questions. All shot on a gopro hero 3

videos.title: FiftyOne Bikes ASSASSIN Gravel Bike Review: Explore. Shred. Race. Tour.
videos.description:
"Based in Dublin, Ireland, FiftyOne Bikes is a manufacturer of hand-built custom road bikes and factory-built gravel bikes. FiftyOne Bikes was founded in 2016 by former international rider Aidan Duff, in response to the disappearance from top-end race bikes of the custom options that he had always enjoyed during his career. " - https://fiftyonebikes.com

"The Assassin is a progressive gravel bike with a massive breadth of ability. Its adjustable geometry creates capability in place of compromise, allowing you to tailor the handling to how you ride. It’s exceptionally light, responsive, and comfortable. In short, Assassin is the answer, whatever question your gravel riding asks."

In this video, JOM of the Gravel Cyclist crew takes the Fifty One Assassin gravel bike, and runs it through the proverbial wringer. From a 200 mile / 320km across Florida adventure, to running it at a mountain bike event!, the entire spectrum of riding this bike is designed for is well covered, along with plenty of tech talk about the Assassin's features.

Links of Interest:
FiftyOne Bikes - https://fiftyonebikes.com
SRAM Rival eTap AXS Long-Term Review - https://wp.me/p4V4se-cLN
BERD Spokes / ENVE G23 Carbon Gravel Wheelset Review - 1,226 grams! - https://wp.me/p4V4se-8I4
King's Road Coast to Coast: 200 Miles Across Florida! - https://wp.me/p4V4se-dDq
Gravel Cyclist's Route Library - https://www.gravelcyclist.com/gravel-cycling-routes/

Amazon Affiliation Link:
No cost to you, but every purchase made helps keep Gravel Cyclist up and running! - https://www.amazon.com/?&_encoding=UTF8&tag=gravelcyclist-20&linkCode=ur2&linkId=6b862b6af640d29360e2af2a5f17ddc6&camp=1789&creative=9325

Instagram - http://Instagram.com/GravelCyclist
Twitter - http://twitter.com/GravelCyclist

videos.transcript:
[Music]
g'day train
i'm john with gravel cyclists and i'm
coming to you today on a very
cold day here in north central florida
36 degrees fahrenheit or about three
degrees celsius with a review of a bike
i've been putting through the ringer
this is the 51 bikes assassin
gravel bike if you're a regular to this
channel the gravelcyclist.com website
the gravel cyclist instagram and
facebook accounts you will likely have
seen my unboxing and features video and
my sneak peek photographs of my review
process up to this point of this very
bike for those folks who do not follow
my social media do yourself a favor and
check them out in the links below first
a little company history about dublin
ireland based 51 bikes the company was
founded in 2016 by mr aidan duff a
former professional cyclist who turned
his hand
to the creation of bespoke bicycles the
name 51 is a homage to a special race
number used in european professional
road cycling usually that number is
reserved for team leaders or special
writers and originally came about around
the time of mr eddie merks he made that
number quite famous in his heyday as i
mentioned earlier 51 bikes specializes
in custom bespoke bikes from their
dublin island headquarters from special
frame designs
to gorgeous custom paint and other finer
details this assassin gravel bike to my
right is a departure from 51's usual
manner of producing bikes in that it was
manufactured in asia to the company's
exacting standards this bike is
available with three color options
british racing green as you see here
currently the bike is absolutely filthy
as it should be most of the time
rothman's racing blue and
complete bespoke paint
anything goes from wild to mild the
assassin features a multi-blend taurei
carbon fiber frame from three different
types of carbon fiber with tyre
clearance front and rear for 650b and
700c by 47 millimeters but i'm pretty
confident you could fit 50 millimeter
tires inside this bike but of course
that wouldn't allow for a whole ton of
mud clearance there's also provision for
one buy or two by drivetrains and as you
can see in this example
a two by drive train namely the
excellent sram rival etap access and i
have a full review of that groupset
linked below the stock build will set
that arrived with this bike hold on one
second
right here
this is the dt swiss
g 1800 wheel set shod with wtb riddler
tires in 700c by 45 millimeter i saved
this wheel set for some of the more
gnarly riding that i did that you'll see
during my ride experience part of this
review for much of the review
i rode the
excellent and ultra light envy g23
wheels with bird spokes you can also
check out a review of this wheel set
linked below the assassin is touted as a
progressive gravel bike nowadays that
generally means a longer top tube
shorter stem almost mountain bike like
in design 51 isn't alone with this
concept there are several manufacturers
circuit the time of this video with
bikes designed in a similar manner this
isn't my favorite geometry but i will
say 51's take has worked fabulously for
me and i have my position locked in
after just one short shakedown ride the
assassin features adjustable geometry
courtesy of a flip chip system at the
front and rear of the bike this is not
the first bike overview with such a
feature in fact this design has been
around for a couple of years at the rear
of the bike you get three different
positions short medium and long an east
position change affects the overall
chainstay length by five millimeter
increments theoretically the short
position gives you agility the long
position stability and the middle the
best of both worlds i rode the bike in
the middle position for much of this
review
the forecast two positions high and low
low provides longer trail and a slacker
head tube angle best suited to more
aggressive riding on challenging terrain
whilst high creates shorter trail and a
steeper head angle really nice for
racing spirited rides or not so rough
terrain i've ridden both positions
extensively more on that later
speaking of geometry this is what the
size medium this example here looks like
on paper in the rear middle position and
on the low front position so in the
middle rear and low front position you
get a wheelbase of
1052 millimeters or middle rear and
front high you get
1057 millimeters of interest the trail
figures for this bike are uniform across
the board in all chip positions no
matter the size of buy and now it's time
for a little demonstration of how simple
it is to swap the flip chip on the fork
currently the chip resides in the bottom
position for this exercise i'm going to
swap the chip to the higher position
thus i'll need to remove the fixing bolt
right there
swap this around and likewise on the
other side of the fork
2.5 millimeter allen key required
and you can see
the little flip mechanism is already
loosened off
apologies for the bright sunshine here
might pop out the little
chip
let's get them in focus
there we go flip around
then simply reinstall the
fixing screw
that operation is done
repeat the process from the other side
i have to say i've flipped a few chips
and this one is easiest to deal with
reinstall
and then
tighten down the fixing bolt
being careful not to over tighten
and reinstall the front wheel
all right bob's your uncle no walking
furries
one thing you might be wondering did i
adjust the position of the front brake
to account for the change i made in the
chip position that is a no
other features of the assassin all the
cables are internalized including
through the fork the front brake runs
through the right side of the fork and
if you happen to utilize a dynamo front
hub for generating power that also is
internalized through the left side of
the fork there's also support for an
internalized dropper seat post and for
bottle cage mounts you get the usual two
places one on top of the down tube one
on the seat tube and a bonus bottle cage
mount beneath the down tube and not
forgetting my favorite mounting point
atop the top tube in this case with an
apadura top tube racing bag and i had
that linked as well in the description
below the fork also features mounts on
each leg for additional versatility
finally the bottom bracket standard is
threaded t47
and another nice feature beneath the
removable down to protector you get
access to the inside of the frame and
for folks who run shimano's di2
electronic drivetrain the battery
resides behind that protector so that's
the tech features covered let's find out
now how the 51 bikes assassin gravel
bike
rides
weighing in at near 21.5 pounds or 9.7
kilos with the stock dt 1800 wheels
riddler 700 c by 45 millimeter tyres
king titanium bottle cages and garmin
xc200 pedals the assassin isn't overly
light but once i swapped the wheels for
the envy bird spoke wheels i showed
earlier the bike's overall weight
dropped by close to two pounds or almost
a full kilogram of weight whilst light
weight is not this bike's primary focus
it's one you should spec out carefully
if you're interested in shedding some
grams
on the positive it took just one 25 mile
shakedown ride to dial in my fit and
despite all of my reservations about
this longer top tube shorter stem
concept the assassin felt spot on the
best i've felt aboard any bike of this
type this is handy as the second ride
aboard the assassin was 200 miles of
florida mixed surface roads in one day
west coast to east coast part of the
kings road event hosted by the single
track samurai i kept the fork in the low
position and the rear in the middle
position 200 miles isn't something you
can bluff in terms of fitness or bike
setup and this was a very solid test
between the wheelbase and the long trail
fork setting the assassin feels stable
and predictable but steering didn't feel
overly slow rather i feel you ghana a
happy medium of control for dodgy
terrain whilst the fork imbibes
confidence turning into corners clearly
the shorter stem is helping here and at
the rear wheel with your weight
distributed appropriately you get
traction and power transfer something i
really appreciate on loose terrain i
especially felt this riding in dodgy
brick road sector complete with many
sandy spots under the cover of darkness
this adventure required me to keep a
light touch on the handlebar and focus
on pedaling a high cadence with my
weight pushed back
once i got into my groove and good
skills do help i was the first rider
through this eight mile sector of the
drop bar bikes that were present the
remainder of this course was a huge
mixed bag from fast forest roads that
feature more craters than the aftermath
of a b-52 carpet bombing run and some
hellacious washboard two tough sandy
roads tyre clearance is impressive and
the taller than most bottom bracket drop
works perfectly for bigger tire casings
case in point zero pedal strikes when i
chose to ride this bike at the 2022 tour
de filasco a 50 mile mountain bike ride
in north florida would i recommend
riding a rigid bike on rooty trails
negative but i was decently competitive
in the speed department with a ride time
of just over five hours the assassin
handled absolutely everything i threw at
it including some dicey moments when i
pointed towards a rooty drop off weight
back and hope for the best to quote a
well used cliche this was under biking
at its finest flipping the fork's chip
as i demonstrated earlier is almost akin
from riding a cruiser motorcycle in the
low position to a track focused
motorcycle in the higher position the
difference was enough to be noticeable
and this would be a great setup for
spirited riding and racing particularly
when you're on the rear chip in its most
forward position this wouldn't be my
bike of choice for a shorter spirited
mixed surface group ride with my mates
but when you're talking about rides or
events clocking over 100 miles now we're
talking with that said i really
preferred the low fork setting for my
general riding about along with the
middle rear chip position the assassin
just felt extra comfortable in this
configuration this is important because
the assassin feels quite stiff for a
bike of this nature but with huge tyre
clearance dropping the tire pressure
solves their problem i have to say i'm
really stoked the bike industry has
finally caught up with my gripes
concerning bike designs from just a few
years ago it's great to see clearance of
700 c by 47 millimeter and greater
nowadays around 2013 i built a drop bar
mountain bike just to solve this tyre
clearance dilemma for the gnarly events
i was partaking in at the time the
assassin doesn't feel as sprightly as
more performance oriented gravel bikes
this is evident pushing it out of the
saddle or climbing but this bike is bomb
proof stable and confidence inspiring
when descending or riding rough and
dodgy terrain drivetrain support i love
the two buy so i'm chuffed to see the 51
isn't jamming one by only down
everybody's throats we like choices
overall i like how this bike looks with
its integrated cables beautiful paint
and not over the top branding this bike
won't be for everyone but as far as
ultra versatile gravel bikes with
adjustable chip geometry longer top
tubes and shorter stems i feel the
assassin is the standout option at the
time of this video the assassin is a
pricey bike you're looking at about
three and a half thousand euro or about
us four thousand dollars for the frame
and fork before you factor in any build
kits wheels and so on this bike is a
media sample so its spec is likely going
to differ from the pre-built bikes
available direct from 51 bikes so there
you have it my review of the extremely
versatile 51 assassin gravel bike i
realized at the time of this video there
is a smorgasbord a plethora a cornucopia
of gravel bikes on the market for you to
choose from so i hope that my review
went somewhere in helping you make an
informed purchase decision thank you for
watching if you haven't already please
consider subscribing to the gravel
cyclist youtube channel for no
gravel bike reviews such as this product
reviews ride experience videos and other
madness as all of it is released to the
channel i'll see you
in the next video
and it's time to get my ass inside
because it is freezing out here
you

quotes.text: This back stretch is hard hill and hill up and down man. We just tackled the serious hill with a 21-8 average, 2061 feet of ascent - that's like serious elevation gain.

We started out with the first group rolling at about 28-30 mph, just cracking that whip. There's a lot of distance and climbing - one rider's race ended at the 13-mile marker when he hit a pothole deep enough to drop his chain.
